channel.title: Publications on Becky's Curriculum Vitae
channel.description: Recent content in Publications on Becky's Curriculum Vitae

item.title: On the development of two progressive constructions in U̱t-Ma'in
item.description: Citeable as: Paterson, Rebecca Dow. 2019. On the development of two progressive constructions in U̠t-Ma’in. Folia Linguistica Historica 40 (2): 509-554. 10.1515/flih-2019-0020 Comments:

item.title: Nominalization and predication in U̱t-Ma'in
item.description: Citeable as: Paterson, Rebecca Dow Smith. 2019. Nominalization and predication in U̱t-Ma’in. Ph. D Dissertation, University of Oregon. Eugene, Oregon. Comments:

item.title: Narrative uses of the u̱t-Ma'in (Kainji) Bare Verb form
item.description: Citeable as: Paterson, Rebecca D. 2015. Narrative uses of the u̱t-Ma’in (Kainji) Bare Verb form. In Doris L. Payne and Shahar Shirtz (eds.), Beyond aspect: the expression of discourse functions in African languages (Typological Studies in Language 109), 219–248. Amsterdam: John Benjamins Publishing Company. 10.1075/tsl.109.08pat Comments: The content of this publication was first presented at SLE 2013.

item.title: Semantics of u̱t-Ma'in noun classes
item.description: Citeable as: Paterson, Rebecca D. 2012. Semantics of U̱t-Ma’in noun classes. In Roger Blench and Stuart McGill (eds.). Advances in minority language research in Nigeria, volume 1, 239-272. Köln: Rüdiger Köppe. Comments:

item.title: The noun class system of u̱t-Ma'in, a West Kainji language of Northwestern Nigeria
item.description: Citeable as: Smith, Rebecca. D. 2007. The noun class system of u̱t-Ma’in, a West Kainji language of Northwestern Nigeria. M.A. Thesis, University of North Dakota. Available online: http://arts-sciences.und.edu/summer-institute-of-linguistics/theses/2007-smith-rebecca-d.cfm Comments:
